{"word": "argue", "phonetic": "/ˈɑːrɡjuː/", "suggestion": null, "definitions": [{"examples": ["The lawyer will argue the case before the judge.", "They argued for hours about the best way to solve the problem.", "The professor argued that climate change is a serious threat to global stability.", "The two friends argued over who was the better singer.", "The researchers argued that their findings supported the new theory.", "The politician argued that the economy was improving."], "definition": "to give reasons or cite evidence in order to support a claim, point of view, or conclusion", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "verb", "definition_native": "donner des raisons ou citer des preuves pour soutenir une affirmation, un point de vue ou une conclusion"}, {"examples": ["The couple argued about their finances and nearly broke up.", "The neighbors argued over the noise level and called the police.", "The coworkers argued about the project deadline and their roles.", "The friends argued about the best restaurant in town.", "The family members argued about the inheritance and their relationships.", "The two teams argued over the referee's call."], "definition": "to exchange or express opposing views, often in a heated or angry manner", "cultural_notes": "In some cultures, arguing is seen as a sign of disrespect or aggression, while in others it is viewed as a healthy and necessary part of communication and debate.", "part_of_speech": "verb", "definition_native": "échanger ou exprimer des opinions opposées, souvent de manière passionnée ou en colère"}], "translations": ["discuter", "débattre", "soutenir"], "valid_word_score": 1.0}

{"word": "approximate", "phonetic": "/əˈprɒksɪmət/", "suggestion": null, "definitions": [{"examples": ["The approximate cost of the project is $10,000.", "The approximate time of arrival is 5:00 PM.", "The scientist made an approximate calculation of the distance.", "The approximate age of the ancient artifact is 2,000 years.", "The approximate number of attendees is 500.", "The map provides an approximate location of the nearest hospital."], "definition": "close to the actual or exact value, but not precisely known", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "adjective", "definition_native": "proche de la valeur réelle ou exacte, mais pas précisément connue"}, {"examples": ["The researcher approximated the population size based on the sample data.", "The contractor approximated the cost of the repairs.", "The astronomer approximated the distance to the star.", "The engineer approximated the stress on the bridge.", "The doctor approximated the time of death.", "The analyst approximated the impact of the policy change."], "definition": "to estimate or calculate something approximately", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "verb", "definition_native": "estimer ou calculer quelque chose approximativement"}], "translations": ["approximatif", "à peu près", "environ"], "valid_word_score": 1.0}
